metadata.Title: CVE-2021-39800 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - negligible.
metadata.Description: In ion_ioctl of ion-ioctl.c, there is a possible way to leak kernel head data due to a use after free. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-208277166References: Upstream kernel

notes.Note: sbeattie> CONFIG_ION is disabled in Ubuntu kernels (with the exception of linux-xilinx-zynqmp/focal), so are not affected by this. the ION memory manager was removed from the kernel in e722a295cf49 ("staging: ion: remove from the tree") (v5.11-rc1)

criterions.comment: linux-oem-5.13: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was not-affected').
linux-signed-oem-5.13: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was not-affected').
